point.label: ArGraMod
point.description: Indicates if gradients trend toward zero at the edges of the deadband or trend toward zero at the center of the deadband.

point.label: ArGraSag
point.description: The gradient used to increase capacitive dynamic current. A value of 0 indicates no additional reactive current support.

point.label: ArGraSwell
point.description: The gradient used to increase inductive dynamic current. A value of 0 indicates no additional reactive current support.

point.label: FilTms
point.description: The time window used to calculate the moving average voltage.

point.label: DbVMin
point.description: The lower delta voltage limit for which negative voltage deviations less than this value no dynamic vars are produced.

point.label: DbVMax
point.description: The upper delta voltage limit for which positive voltage deviations less than this value no dynamic current produced.

point.label: VRefPct_SF
point.description: Scale factor for the voltage zone and limit settings.

point.label: BlkZnV
point.description: Block zone voltage which defines a lower voltage boundary below which no dynamic current is produced.

point.label: BlkZnTmms
point.description: Block zone time the time before which reactive current support remains active regardless of how low the voltage drops.

point.label: HoldTmms
point.description: Hold time during which reactive current support continues after the average voltage has entered the dead zone.
